Assessments_v2_attemptResult.title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Practice Exam (CLF-C01) - 6

domainGradeBreakdown.domainDescription: This represents exam questions for the Cloud Computing section.
This represents exam questions for the Security & Compliance section.
This represents exam questions for the Technology section.
This represents exam questions for the Billing & Pricing section.

questions.questionText: Which benefit of cloud computing helps you innovate faster and gives you speed to market?

choices.explanation: Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time. These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.

correctAnswers.explanation: The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are examples of programmatic access?

choices.explanation: The CLI allows you to manage AWS services from a terminal session on your machine.
SDKs allow you to access AWS services from popular programming languages like Java, Python, C#, and many more.
AWS services can be accessed from application code using SDKs and programmatic calls.
The AWS Management Console allows you to access your AWS account and manage applications running in your account from a web browser.

correctAnswers.explanation: The CLI allows you to manage AWS services from a terminal session on your machine.
SDKs allow you to access AWS services from popular programming languages like Java, Python, C#, and many more.
AWS services can be accessed from application code using SDKs and programmatic calls.

questions.questionText: Upon which of these measurements is AWS Lambda pricing based?

choices.explanation:
With AWS Lambda, you are charged based on the number of requests for your functions and the amount of time (duration) it takes for your code to execute.  The duration depends on the amount of memory you allocate to your function. 
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

With AWS Lambda, you are charged based on the number of requests for your functions and the amount of time (duration) it takes for your code to execute.
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

choices.text: Cost of the Lambda function's execution role in AWS IAM.
choices.explanation:
This is NOT a measurement factored into the price for AWS Lambda.  AWS IAM roles have no cost.
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

Many types of data transfer with Lambda is free, but some can have a charge.  The change depends on the specific services involved and the data transfer path ( Example: in region or across regions).
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

correctAnswers.explanation:
With AWS Lambda, you are charged based on the number of requests for your functions and the amount of time (duration) it takes for your code to execute.  The duration depends on the amount of memory you allocate to your function. 
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

With AWS Lambda, you are charged based on the number of requests for your functions and the amount of time (duration) it takes for your code to execute.
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

Many types of data transfer with Lambda is free, but some can have a charge.  The change depends on the specific services involved and the data transfer path ( Example: in region or across regions).
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Cost of the Lambda function's execution role in AWS IAM.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
This is NOT a measurement factored into the price for AWS Lambda.  AWS IAM roles have no cost.
`https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/pricing/`

questions.questionText: Enabling Amazon GuardDuty automatically grants the service permission to analyze continuous metadata streams from which of the following data sources?

choices.explanation:
This option only works if you use AWS DNS resolvers for your EC2 instances. GuardDuty will be able to access and process your request and response DNS logs through the internal DNS resolvers. When you enable GuardDuty, it will immediately start analyzing DNS logs through an independent data stream.

[DNS Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_dns)

VPC Flow Logs captures information about the IP traffic going to and from Amazon EC2 network interfaces in your VPC. When you enable GuardDuty, it immediately starts analyzing your VPC Flow Logs data. It consumes VPC Flow Logs events directly from the VPC Flow Logs feature through an independent and duplicative stream of flow logs.

  [VPC Flow Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_vpc)

AWS CloudTrail provides you with a history of AWS API calls for your account, including API calls made using the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command-line tools, and higher-level AWS services. CloudTrail also allows you to identify which users and accounts called AWS APIs for services that support CloudTrail, the source IP address that the calls were made from, and when the calls occurred. When you enable GuardDuty, it immediately starts analyzing your CloudTrail event logs. It consumes CloudTrail management and S3 data events directly from CloudTrail. 

[AWS CloudTrail Event Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_cloudtrail)

choices.text: Sensitive data in Amazon S3 buckets
choices.explanation: GuardDuty doesn't analyze sensitive data in Amazon S3 buckets,  but Amazon Macie can use machine learning (ML) and pattern matching to discover and protect sensitive data.

correctAnswers.explanation:
This option only works if you use AWS DNS resolvers for your EC2 instances. GuardDuty will be able to access and process your request and response DNS logs through the internal DNS resolvers. When you enable GuardDuty, it will immediately start analyzing DNS logs through an independent data stream.

[DNS Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_dns)

VPC Flow Logs captures information about the IP traffic going to and from Amazon EC2 network interfaces in your VPC. When you enable GuardDuty, it immediately starts analyzing your VPC Flow Logs data. It consumes VPC Flow Logs events directly from the VPC Flow Logs feature through an independent and duplicative stream of flow logs.

  [VPC Flow Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_vpc)

AWS CloudTrail provides you with a history of AWS API calls for your account, including API calls made using the AWS Management Console, AWS SDKs, command-line tools, and higher-level AWS services. CloudTrail also allows you to identify which users and accounts called AWS APIs for services that support CloudTrail, the source IP address that the calls were made from, and when the calls occurred. When you enable GuardDuty, it immediately starts analyzing your CloudTrail event logs. It consumes CloudTrail management and S3 data events directly from CloudTrail. 

[AWS CloudTrail Event Logs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/latest/ug/guardduty_data-sources.html#guardduty_cloudtrail)

questions.questionText: Your company hosts gaming applications online and would like to deliver these apps to a worldwide audience. Which AWS service would enable delivery to users worldwide and greatly improve response times?

choices.explanation: CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.
DynamoDB is a NoSQL database.
CloudFormation enables the configuration of AWS resources using CloudFormation templates (Infrastructure as Code). It is not for delivery.

ElastiCache is a fully managed in-memory datastore compatible with Redis or Memcached.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticache/

correctAnswers.explanation: CloudFront is a CDN that delivers data and applications globally with low latency.

questions.questionText: You need to execute code in response to a specific change to your S3 bucket. Which of the following compute services should you choose to execute your code?

choices.explanation: Lightsail allows you to quickly launch all the resources you need for small projects.
EC2 allows you to rent and manage virtual servers in the cloud.
Direct Connect is a dedicated physical network connection from your on-premises data center to AWS.

Lambda is event-driven, and a change to an S3 bucket is an example of an event.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Lambda is event-driven, and a change to an S3 bucket is an example of an event.
https://aws.amazon.com/lambda/

questions.questionText: Which of the following describes a subnet accurately?

choices.text: A segment of a VPC’s IP address range where you can place groups of isolated resources.
choices.explanation: A virtual private cloud, or VPC, is the virtual network you create in your AWS account. When you create a VPC, you split it into smaller network segments by specifying a range of IP addresses. These segments are referred to as subnets, and this is where you launch your AWS resources. [What Is Amazon VPC?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html).

choices.text: The Amazon VPC side of a connection to the public Internet.
choices.explanation: Internet Gateway is the Amazon VPC side of a connection to the public Internet. [Amazon VPC FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/faqs/).

choices.text: A logically isolated virtual network in the AWS cloud.
choices.explanation: A Virtual Private Cloud is a logically isolated virtual network in the AWS cloud. You define a VPC’s IP address space from ranges you select. [Amazon VPC FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/faqs/).

choices.text: The Amazon VPC side of a VPN connection.
choices.explanation: Virtual private gateway is the Amazon VPC side of a VPN connection. [Amazon VPC FAQs](https://aws.amazon.com/vpc/faqs/).

correctAnswers.text: A segment of a VPC’s IP address range where you can place groups of isolated resources.
correctAnswers.explanation: A virtual private cloud, or VPC, is the virtual network you create in your AWS account. When you create a VPC, you split it into smaller network segments by specifying a range of IP addresses. These segments are referred to as subnets, and this is where you launch your AWS resources. [What Is Amazon VPC?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html).

questions.questionText: Which deployment types offers the advantages of cloud computing?

choices.explanation: Public cloud (offered by AWS) provides advantages of cloud computing.
A hybrid cloud is a combination of public and private clouds.

Deploying resources on-premises, using virtualization and resource management tools, is sometimes called “private cloud”. On-premises deployment does not provide many of the benefits of cloud computing but is sometimes sought for its ability to provide dedicated resources.

Deploying resources on-premises, using virtualization and resource management tools, is sometimes called “private cloud”. On-premises deployment does not provide many of the benefits of cloud computing but is sometimes sought for its ability to provide dedicated resources.

correctAnswers.explanation: Public cloud (offered by AWS) provides advantages of cloud computing.
A hybrid cloud is a combination of public and private clouds.

questions.questionText: You are using your corporate directory to grant your users access to AWS services. What is this called?

choices.explanation: Multi-Factor Authentication is the concept of a user requiring 2 secrets to be able to access the resources — usually their password and a one-time code provided by a device under their control (e.g., a mobile phone).
Role-based access is used to define which resources a user is able to access once they have access, not the method by which they gain that access.

Federated access is when you use an external directory, such as your corporate one, to grant users in that directory access to AWS resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/identity/federation/
User group access is used to define which resources a user is able to access once they have access, not the method by which they gain that access.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Federated access is when you use an external directory, such as your corporate one, to grant users in that directory access to AWS resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/identity/federation/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: User group access is used to define which resources a user is able to access once they have access, not the method by which they gain that access.

questions.questionText: Which of the following support plans features access to Enhanced Technical Support via email only during business hours?

choices.explanation: The Business Support plan provides 24x7 email support, not just during business hours.

The Developer Support plan features access to Enhanced Technical Support during business hours via email.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/
The Enterprise Support plans provides 24x7 email support, not just during business hours.
The Basic Support plan does not include any Enhanced Technical Support email options.

correctAnswers.explanation:
The Developer Support plan features access to Enhanced Technical Support during business hours via email.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

questions.questionText: Which component of the AWS Global Infrastructure caches content for fast delivery to users?

choices.explanation:
Availability Zones (AZs) consist of one or more physically separated data centers, each with redundant power,
networking, and connectivity, housed in separate facilities.
Edge locations cache content for fast delivery to your users.
A Region is a physical location.
Availability Zones (AZs) consist of one or more physically separated data centers.

correctAnswers.explanation: Edge locations cache content for fast delivery to your users.

questions.questionText: AWS uses the shared responsibility model. For security, which of the following are the responsibilities of AWS?

choices.explanation: AWS is in charge of physically securing compute resources, as it is part of the infrastructure that runs all of the services offered in the AWS cloud.
All passwords are the responsibility of the customer, as they are in charge of their information.
This is the customer's responsibility, as customers are responsible for setting up their security groups.
Disk disposal is one of AWS's responsibilities, as it is connected to the infrastructure AWS handles.
Network patching is one of AWS's responsibilities, as it is connected to the infrastructure AWS handles.

correctAnswers.explanation: AWS is in charge of physically securing compute resources, as it is part of the infrastructure that runs all of the services offered in the AWS cloud.
Disk disposal is one of AWS's responsibilities, as it is connected to the infrastructure AWS handles.
Network patching is one of AWS's responsibilities, as it is connected to the infrastructure AWS handles.

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services controls authentication and authorization within an AWS account?

choices.explanation: Access control lists provide fine-grain control over security and access to resources.
AWS Shield is a separate service that helps protect resources from external attacks.

IAM (Identity and Access Management) controls authentication and authorization within an AWS account.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/
Security groups and access control lists are tools within IAM which can help make that control easier to manage.

correctAnswers.explanation:
IAM (Identity and Access Management) controls authentication and authorization within an AWS account.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/details/

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services can be used to create billing alarms?

choices.explanation:
The CloudWatch service is used to create billing alarms.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/monitor_estimated_charges_with_cloudwatch.html
The Cost Explorer service is used to create custom reports that facilitate the understanding of the organization's costs and data usage.
Macie is a service used to identify sensitive data such as personally identifiable information (PII) stored in S3.
The Athena service analyzes data using SQL queries stored in S3.

correctAnswers.explanation:
The CloudWatch service is used to create billing alarms.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/monitor_estimated_charges_with_cloudwatch.html

questions.questionText: When considering the security of an AWS EC2 instance, which of the below are users responsible for?

choices.explanation: AWS controls access to its data centers where your data resides.

Under the Shared Responsibility Model, users are entirely responsible for the security, patching, and maintenance of AWS IaaS services such as EC2. AWS will only take care of the underlying hardware used to provide the service.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

choices.text: Patching and maintenance of server hardware
choices.explanation: AWS maintains the physical hardware.

choices.text: Patching and maintenance of OS and applications
choices.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model, users are entirely responsible for the security, patching, and maintenance of AWS IaaS services such as EC2. AWS will only take care of the underlying hardware used to provide the service.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model, users are entirely responsible for the security, patching, and maintenance of AWS IaaS services such as EC2. AWS will only take care of the underlying hardware used to provide the service.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

correctAnswers.text: Patching and maintenance of OS and applications
correctAnswers.explanation:
Under the Shared Responsibility Model, users are entirely responsible for the security, patching, and maintenance of AWS IaaS services such as EC2. AWS will only take care of the underlying hardware used to provide the service.
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

questions.questionText: An auditor is conducting an audit of your IT operations for compliance. The auditor requests visibility to logs of event history across your AWS-based employee expense system infrastructure. Which AWS service will record and provide you the information you need?

choices.explanation:
AWS CloudTrail provides visibility to API call activity for AWS infrastructure and other services. AWS Cloudwatch Logs might be part of a centralized logging solution, but all API event information will come from CloudTrail. AWS Systems Manager can process EC2 logs only, and AWS Compliance Manager is not a service offered by AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/
There is not a service called AWS Compliance Manager.
While CloudWatch does produce logs, those are application-based logs.
Systems Manager gives you visibility into and control over your AWS resources.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS CloudTrail provides visibility to API call activity for AWS infrastructure and other services. AWS Cloudwatch Logs might be part of a centralized logging solution, but all API event information will come from CloudTrail. AWS Systems Manager can process EC2 logs only, and AWS Compliance Manager is not a service offered by AWS.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

questions.questionText: Your company has entered into a 3-year contract with a government agency. Your best option for EC2 is Reserved Instances. Which AWS feature would you use to track your Reserved Instance usage?

choices.explanation:
Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

The Cost and Usage Report contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data.
https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-and-usage-reporting/

Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

correctAnswers.explanation:
The Cost and Usage Report contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data.
https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-and-usage-reporting/

questions.questionText: Users need to access AWS resources from the Command Line Interface. Which IAM option can be used for authentication?

choices.explanation:
A group is a collection of IAM users that helps you apply common access controls to all group members.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_groups.html

You must provide your AWS access keys to make programmatic calls to AWS or to use the AWS Command Line Interface or AWS Tools for PowerShell.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-sec-cred-types.html

You manage permissions for IAM users, groups, and roles by creating a policy document in JSON format and attaching it.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies.html

Roles define access permissions and are temporarily assumed by an IAM user or service.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_roles.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
You must provide your AWS access keys to make programmatic calls to AWS or to use the AWS Command Line Interface or AWS Tools for PowerShell.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-sec-cred-types.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
You manage permissions for IAM users, groups, and roles by creating a policy document in JSON format and attaching it.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/access_policies.html

questions.questionText: You need to set up a virtual firewall for your EC2 instance. Which would you use?

choices.explanation:
A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to protect your EC2 instance by controlling inbound and outbound traffic.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_SecurityGroups.html
You manage permissions for IAM users, groups, and roles by creating a policy document in JSON format and attaching it.
A subnet allows you to split the network inside the VPC. This is where you launch resources like EC2 instances.
The NACL acts as a firewall at the subnet level, not the instance level.

correctAnswers.explanation:
A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to protect your EC2 instance by controlling inbound and outbound traffic.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_SecurityGroups.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: The NACL acts as a firewall at the subnet level, not the instance level.

questions.questionText: Which defines one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity?

choices.explanation: AWS Local Zones allow you to use select AWS services, like compute and storage services, closer to more end-users, providing them very low latency access to the applications running locally.

An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. AZs are physically separated by a meaningful distance, many kilometers, from any other AZ, although all are within 100 km (60 miles) of each other. [Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2#Availability_Zones).
Edge locations cache content for fast delivery to your users.
A Region is global and has 2 or more Availability Zones. Regions are geographically isolated locations around the globe.

correctAnswers.explanation: An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. AZs are physically separated by a meaningful distance, many kilometers, from any other AZ, although all are within 100 km (60 miles) of each other. [Availability Zones](https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/?p=ngi&loc=2#Availability_Zones).

questions.questionText: How are permissions assigned to an IAM group?

choices.explanation: Access is assigned using policies and roles.
Access is assigned using policies and roles.
A security group is a virtual firewall for an EC2 instance.
There is no such thing as a collection.

correctAnswers.explanation: Access is assigned using policies and roles.
Access is assigned using policies and roles.

questions.questionText: You are leading a pilot program to try the AWS Cloud for 1 of your applications. You have been instructed to provide an estimate of your AWS bill. Which service will allow you to do this by manually entering your planned resources by service?

choices.explanation:
Cost Explorer allows you to visualize and forecast your costs and usage over time.
https://aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/aws-cost-explorer/

With the AWS Pricing Calculator, you can input the services you will use, as well as the configuration of those services, and get an estimate of the costs these services will accrue. The AWS Pricing Calculator can also help with calculating the total cost of ownership.

This is a report rather than a projection. The Cost and Usage Report contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/cost-usage-report/#:~:text=AWS%20Cost%20and%20Usage%20reports,S3)%20bucket%20of%20your%20choice.&text=csv%20format%20from%20the%20S3,Amazon%20QuickSight%2C%20or%20Amazon%20Redshift.

CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

correctAnswers.explanation: With the AWS Pricing Calculator, you can input the services you will use, as well as the configuration of those services, and get an estimate of the costs these services will accrue. The AWS Pricing Calculator can also help with calculating the total cost of ownership.

questions.questionText: When architecting a solution on AWS, it is important to know if you are designing for zero downtime even if a component fails or if you are designing for reliable performance and minimal (but non-zero) downtime. Which of the following terms best describes the latter solution?

choices.explanation: Designing for high availability provides a high uptime percentage, but downtime can still happen. Designing a solution for high availability is much cheaper than designing for fault tolerance. A fault-tolerant system is also highly available but can remain in service if one or more components of the system fails.

Fault tolerance describes a system that is designed to remain in service if one or more components of the system fails. Designing a solution for fault tolerance is much more expensive than designing for just high availability.

Elastic systems can scale based on demand. As an example, EC2 autoscaling groups can horizontally scale elastically (dynamically adding or removing instances. EC2 instances can also vertically scale (by a change of their instance size), but that is a manual scaling, so it is not elastic.
Scalability is the ability to grow or shrink based on the demand of a service. Scaling can be an automatic or manual process. When scaling happens automatically, it is considered elastic as well.

correctAnswers.explanation: Designing for high availability provides a high uptime percentage, but downtime can still happen. Designing a solution for high availability is much cheaper than designing for fault tolerance. A fault-tolerant system is also highly available but can remain in service if one or more components of the system fails.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Fault tolerance describes a system that is designed to remain in service if one or more components of the system fails. Designing a solution for fault tolerance is much more expensive than designing for just high availability.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is AWS' managed DDoS protection service?

choices.explanation: AWS WAF provides protection from common exploits against your web applications at Layer 7, and does not protect against DDoS attacks.
Access control lists provide fine-grain control over security and access to resources.

AWS Shield is AWS' managed DDoS protection service at Layer 4.
https://aws.amazon.com/shield/?nc2=h_l3_dm
Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Shield is AWS' managed DDoS protection service at Layer 4.
https://aws.amazon.com/shield/?nc2=h_l3_dm

questions.questionText: Which of the following are characteristics of Availability Zones (AZs)?

choices.text: Data centers housed in the same facility
choices.explanation: AZs are housed in separate facilities.
AZs are physically separated.
AZs are fault tolerant.
AZs are connected to each other through low-latency links.

correctAnswers.explanation: AZs are physically separated.
AZs are fault tolerant.
AZs are connected to each other through low-latency links.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: Data centers housed in the same facility
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: AZs are housed in separate facilities.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true of Amazon Aurora?

choices.text: You can use the AWS Management Console, AWS CLI commands, and API operations to handle routine database tasks.
choices.explanation:
You can handle routine database tasks on it using either the AWS Management Console, AWS CLI commands, or API operations.
Reference: [What Is Amazon Aurora?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/CHAP_AuroraOverview.html)

choices.text: It is compatible with the MySQL and PostgreSQL database engines.
choices.explanation:
Amazon Aurora is compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL.
Reference: [What Is Amazon Aurora?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/CHAP_AuroraOverview.html)

choices.text: It is part of the Amazon DynamoDB service.
choices.explanation: As a relational database offering, Amazon Aurora is part of the RDS service, not DynamoDB, which is AWS’ nonrelational database service.

choices.text: It can deliver up to three times the throughput of MySQL.
choices.explanation: Aurora delivers up to five times the throughput of MySQL, not three times.

correctAnswers.text: You can use the AWS Management Console, AWS CLI commands, and API operations to handle routine database tasks.
correctAnswers.explanation:
You can handle routine database tasks on it using either the AWS Management Console, AWS CLI commands, or API operations.
Reference: [What Is Amazon Aurora?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/CHAP_AuroraOverview.html)

correctAnswers.text: It is compatible with the MySQL and PostgreSQL database engines.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon Aurora is compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL.
Reference: [What Is Amazon Aurora?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/CHAP_AuroraOverview.html)

questions.questionText: Which of the following falls under the AWS compute services category?

choices.explanation: ElastiCache is a database service.
EMR is analytics service.
Amazon Elastic Beanstalk is an example of a compute service.
AWS Lambda is an example of a compute service.
Rekognition is a machine learning service.

correctAnswers.explanation: Amazon Elastic Beanstalk is an example of a compute service.
AWS Lambda is an example of a compute service.

questions.questionText: Which term refers to the Identity and Access Management (IAM) resource objects that AWS uses for authentication?

choices.explanation:
A principal is a person or application that uses the AWS account root user, an IAM user, or an IAM role to sign in and make requests to AWS.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/intro-structure.html
An identity is an IAM resource object that is used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.
A resource is a user, group, role, policy, or identity provider object that is stored in IAM. As with other AWS services, you can add, edit, and remove resources from IAM.

IAM entities are the users (IAM users and federated users) and roles that are created and used for authentication.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/intro-structure.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
IAM entities are the users (IAM users and federated users) and roles that are created and used for authentication.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/intro-structure.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: An identity is an IAM resource object that is used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.

questions.questionText: Trusted Advisor is classified as what type of AWS service?

choices.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor is a Management and Governance tool.
AWS Trusted Advisor is a Management and Governance tool.
AWS Trusted Advisor is a Management and Governance tool.

AWS Trusted Advisor is a Management and Governance tool. It guides you on how to best manage your resources based on AWS best practices in five categories.
[AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/)
[AWS Trusted Advisor](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/)

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Trusted Advisor is a Management and Governance tool. It guides you on how to best manage your resources based on AWS best practices in five categories.
[AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/)
[AWS Trusted Advisor](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/)

questions.questionText: Which benefit of cloud computing allows you to avoid planning ahead of time for how much capacity you need?

choices.explanation: Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time. These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.
Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

correctAnswers.explanation: With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is an AWS managed distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) protection service?

choices.explanation:
GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system that uncovers unauthorized behavior.
Reference: [Guard Duty](https://aws.amazon.com/guardduty/)

WAF helps protect your web applications against common web attacks. With AWS WAF, you can create security rules that block common attack patterns, such as SQL injection or cross-site scripting.
Reference: [WAF](https://aws.amazon.com/waf)
The focus of AWS Inspector is on applications. Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.

Shield is a managed distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) protection service. Shield Standard provides free protection against common and frequently occurring attacks. Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections and 24/7 access to AWS experts for a fee.
Reference: [AWS Shield](https://aws.amazon.com/shield/)

correctAnswers.explanation:
Shield is a managed distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) protection service. Shield Standard provides free protection against common and frequently occurring attacks. Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections and 24/7 access to AWS experts for a fee.
Reference: [AWS Shield](https://aws.amazon.com/shield/)

questions.questionText: A company on the Business Support plan currently runs all their applications in a single Region. They have made the decision to expand to multiple Regions. What is the process to start deploying their applications to the new Regions?

choices.text: Copy the existing Availability Zone group to the new Regions.
choices.explanation: You cannot copy and paste an Availability Zone.

choices.text: Just start deploying the applications to the new Regions.
choices.explanation: You are free to deploy your applications to new Regions. Don't forget: CloudFormation can make the process of provisioning resources easier and repeatable.

choices.text: Open an account and billing support case with AWS Support.
choices.explanation: AWS Support doesn't assist with this type of request.

choices.text: Reach out to their Technical Account Manager (TAM) for assistance.
choices.explanation: Companies on the Business Support plan do not have access to a TAM.

correctAnswers.text: Just start deploying the applications to the new Regions.
correctAnswers.explanation: You are free to deploy your applications to new Regions. Don't forget: CloudFormation can make the process of provisioning resources easier and repeatable.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are characteristics of cloud computing?

choices.explanation: The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing.

choices.text: No extra skills or training are required.
choices.explanation: Skills and training for personnel are required to leverage cloud computing.

choices.text: Services are delivered via the internet.
choices.explanation:
The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing. Services incurred from a cloud services provider are operating expenses, not capital expenses. Capital expenditure (CapEX) is less common with the cloud, in favor of operational expenditure (OpEx). Skills and training for personnel are required to leverage cloud computing.
https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-cloud-computing/
The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing.
Services incurred from a cloud services provider are operating expenses, not capital expenses.  Capital expenditure (CapEx) is less common with the cloud, in favor of operational expenditure (OpEx).

correctAnswers.explanation: The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing.

correctAnswers.text: Services are delivered via the internet.
correctAnswers.explanation:
The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing. Services incurred from a cloud services provider are operating expenses, not capital expenses. Capital expenditure (CapEX) is less common with the cloud, in favor of operational expenditure (OpEx). Skills and training for personnel are required to leverage cloud computing.
https://aws.amazon.com/what-is-cloud-computing/
The on-demand delivery via the internet of services with pay-as-you-go pricing characterizes cloud computing.

questions.questionText: Which of the following provides the least expensive Amazon S3 storage?

choices.explanation:
Both Glacier and Glacier Deep Archive are for data archiving; as a result, they cost a lot less than the One Zone-Infrequent Access and Intelligent Tiering S3 storage classes, which are for more frequently accessed data. Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest cost option.
[Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)
Although S3 Intelligent tiering moves your data between storage classes to find cost savings, it is not the cheapest option.
While Glacier is a cheap option, it is not the cheapest.
This is not the cheapest option.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Both Glacier and Glacier Deep Archive are for data archiving; as a result, they cost a lot less than the One Zone-Infrequent Access and Intelligent Tiering S3 storage classes, which are for more frequently accessed data. Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest cost option.
[Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)

questions.questionText: Which of the following compute services is ideal if you need to run a simple website or a simple e-commerce application?

choices.explanation: Lambda is a serverless compute service that lets you run code without managing servers.

Lightsail is ideal for simple websites or simple e-commerce applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/lightsail/
EC2 allows you to rent and manage virtual servers in the cloud.
Elastic Beanstalk allows you to deploy your web applications and web services to AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Lightsail is ideal for simple websites or simple e-commerce applications.
https://aws.amazon.com/lightsail/

questions.questionText: Which of the following falls under AWS compute services category?

choices.explanation:
Lightsail is a compute service.
[Amazon Web Services (AWS)](https://aws.amazon.com/)
Budgets is a billing service.
Elastic Beanstalk is a compute service used to deploy web applications.
EC2 is a compute service.
Amazon RDS is classified as database service.
EFS is classified as storage service.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Lightsail is a compute service.
[Amazon Web Services (AWS)](https://aws.amazon.com/)
Elastic Beanstalk is a compute service used to deploy web applications.
EC2 is a compute service.

questions.questionText: You are working with IAM and need to attach policies to users, groups, and roles. Which of the following will you be attaching these policies to?

choices.explanation: Principals are a person or application that uses the AWS account root user, an IAM user, or an IAM role to sign in and make requests to AWS.
Entities are the IAM resource objects that AWS uses for authentication. These include IAM users, federated users, and assumed IAM roles.
Identities are the IAM resource objects that are used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.
Resources are the user, group, role, policy, and identity provider objects that are stored in IAM. As with other AWS services, you can add, edit, and remove resources from IAM.

correctAnswers.explanation: Identities are the IAM resource objects that are used to identify and group. You can attach a policy to an IAM identity. These include users, groups, and roles.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are part of the AWS storage services category?

choices.explanation: Storage Gateway is a storage service.
RDS is a database services.
EFS is storage service.
Redshift is classified as database service used for data warehousing, reporting, and analytics.
S3 is a storage service.

correctAnswers.explanation: Storage Gateway is a storage service.
EFS is storage service.
S3 is a storage service.

questions.questionText: Which following statement is true of newly created security groups with their default rules?

choices.text: New security groups block outbound traffic and allow all incoming traffic.
choices.explanation: By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.

choices.text: New security groups allow only outbound traffic and block all incoming traffic.
choices.explanation:
By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_SecurityGroups.html

choices.text: New security groups allow both incoming and outbound traffic.
choices.explanation: By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.

choices.text: New security groups block both incoming and outbound traffic.
choices.explanation: By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.

correctAnswers.text: New security groups allow only outbound traffic and block all incoming traffic.
correctAnswers.explanation:
By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/VPC_SecurityGroups.html

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: New security groups block outbound traffic and allow all incoming traffic.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: By default, new security groups start with only an outbound rule to allow all traffic to leave the instances. You must add rules to enable any inbound traffic.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is true of AWS Lambda?

choices.text: It triggers charges whether your code is running or not.
choices.explanation: This is incorrect. You are only charged when your code executes.

choices.text: It is a serverless computing platform.
choices.explanation: You can build serverless applications composed of functions.

choices.text: It lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
choices.explanation: This is true. Lambda is considered serverless because you can run code without provisioning or managing servers.

choices.text: It supports several popular programming languages for writing application code.
choices.explanation: Lambda supports several popular programming languages like Java, Python, Node.js, etc.

correctAnswers.text: It is a serverless computing platform.
correctAnswers.explanation: You can build serverless applications composed of functions.

correctAnswers.text: It lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers.
correctAnswers.explanation: This is true. Lambda is considered serverless because you can run code without provisioning or managing servers.

correctAnswers.text: It supports several popular programming languages for writing application code.
correctAnswers.explanation: Lambda supports several popular programming languages like Java, Python, Node.js, etc.

questions.questionText: A company has multiple AWS accounts across multiple Regions. Which AWS service can be used to manage these accounts and provide consolidated billing?

choices.explanation:
Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/
CloudFormation allows you to provision AWS resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

Although there are some types of cross-account access you can set up with IAM, it is not intended to handle consolidated billing across accounts.
https://aws.amazon.com/iam/

Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/trusted-advisor/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Organizations allows you to centrally manage multiple AWS accounts under 1 umbrella.
https://aws.amazon.com/organizations/

questions.questionText: How would a customer create a virtual firewall for an EC2 instance?

choices.explanation: A web application firewall (WAF) helps protect your web applications against common web attacks.
AWS Shield is a managed Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection service.
Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances.
IAM groups are used to manage users, not instances.

correctAnswers.explanation: Security groups act as virtual firewalls for EC2 instances.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: A web application firewall (WAF) helps protect your web applications against common web attacks.

questions.questionText: Which of the following engines are classified as relational databases on AWS?

choices.explanation: Redshift is a data warehousing service.

PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)

PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)
DynamoDB is a NoSQL database.

PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)

correctAnswers.explanation:
PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)

PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)

PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Oracle are three types of RDS engines on AWS. By contrast, DynamoDB is Amazon’s nonrelational database solution and RedShift is Amazon's data warehouse service.
[Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)](https://aws.amazon.com/rds/)

questions.questionText: The AWS Global Infrastructure comprises Regions, Availability Zones, and edge locations, and there is a different number of each infrastructure element. Select the option that shows the correct order from greatest to least.

choices.text: Number of Availability Zones > Number of Regions > Number of Edge Locations
choices.explanation:
The number of edge locations is greater than the number of Availability Zones, which is greater than the number of Regions. Regions contain Availability Zones, therefore there will always be more AZs than Regions.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

choices.text: Number of Availability Zones > Number of Edge Locations > Number of Regions
choices.explanation:
The number of edge locations is greater than the number of Availability Zones, which is greater than the number of Regions. Regions contain Availability Zones, therefore there will always be more AZs than Regions.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

choices.text: Number of Edge Locations > Number of Availability Zones > Number of Regions
choices.explanation:
The number of edge locations is greater than the number of Availability Zones, which is greater than the number of Regions. Regions contain Availability Zones, therefore there will always be more AZs than Regions.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

choices.text: Number of Regions > Number of Availability Zones > Number of Edge Locations
choices.explanation:
The number of edge locations is greater than the number of Availability Zones, which is greater than the number of Regions. Regions contain Availability Zones, therefore there will always be more AZs than Regions.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

correctAnswers.text: Number of Edge Locations > Number of Availability Zones > Number of Regions
correctAnswers.explanation:
The number of edge locations is greater than the number of Availability Zones, which is greater than the number of Regions. Regions contain Availability Zones, therefore there will always be more AZs than Regions.
https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/

questions.questionText: You've been tasked with assessing your AWS infrastructure in terms of cost optimization. Which of the following AWS services would help with this task?

choices.explanation: Personal Health Dashboard provides alerts and guidance for AWS events that might affect your resources and applications.

AWS Trusted Advisor is an online tool that provides you with real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/
Systems Manager gives you visibility into and control over your AWS resources.
CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.

correctAnswers.explanation:
AWS Trusted Advisor is an online tool that provides you with real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.
https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/trustedadvisor/

questions.questionText: You have used On-Demand Instances for a month but have met unexpected costs with this choice. Which EC2 option provides up to 90% discount on On-Demand Instances while taking advantage of AWS unused EC2 capacity?

choices.explanation: They are all virtual instances. This term is too general.

Amazon EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices. You can use Spot Instances for various stateless, fault-tolerant, or flexible applications such as big data, containerized workloads, CI/CD, web servers, high-performance computing (HPC), and test and development workloads. Because Spot Instances are tightly integrated with AWS services (such as Auto Scaling, EMR, ECS, CloudFormation, Data Pipeline, and AWS Batch), you can choose how to launch and maintain your applications running on Spot Instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/spot/

Amazon EC2 Dedicated Hosts allow you to use your eligible software licenses from vendors such as Microsoft and Oracle on Amazon EC2, so you get the flexibility and cost-effectiveness of using your own licenses with the resiliency, simplicity, and elasticity of AWS. An Amazon EC2 Dedicated Host is a physical server fully dedicated for your use, so you can help address corporate compliance requirements.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/dedicated-hosts/

They do provide a discount over On-Demand, but not 90%, and they are suited for long-term use.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices. You can use Spot Instances for various stateless, fault-tolerant, or flexible applications such as big data, containerized workloads, CI/CD, web servers, high-performance computing (HPC), and test and development workloads. Because Spot Instances are tightly integrated with AWS services (such as Auto Scaling, EMR, ECS, CloudFormation, Data Pipeline, and AWS Batch), you can choose how to launch and maintain your applications running on Spot Instances.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/spot/

questions.questionText: Your Development team uses 4 On-Demand EC2 instances. Your QA team has 5 Reserved Instances, only 3 of which are being used. Assuming all AWS accounts are under a single AWS Organization, how will the Development team's instances be billed?

choices.text: The Dev team will be billed for 2 instances at On-Demand prices and 2 instances at the Reserved Instance price.
choices.explanation: Since the QA team has 5 Reserved Instances and only 3 are being used, that means 2 of the Reserved Instances are free.  Since both teams belong to the same AWS Organization, the pricing for the 2 unused instances would be applied to 2 of the 4 Dev On-Demand instances.

choices.text: The pricing for the Reserved Instances will shift from QA to Dev.
choices.explanation: This is not how the instances will be billed.

choices.text: All the Dev team's instances will be billed at the Reserved Instance rate.
choices.explanation: This is not how the instances will be billed.

choices.text: All the Dev team's instances will be billed at the On-Demand rate.
choices.explanation: This is not how the instances will be billed.

correctAnswers.text: The Dev team will be billed for 2 instances at On-Demand prices and 2 instances at the Reserved Instance price.
correctAnswers.explanation: Since the QA team has 5 Reserved Instances and only 3 are being used, that means 2 of the Reserved Instances are free.  Since both teams belong to the same AWS Organization, the pricing for the 2 unused instances would be applied to 2 of the 4 Dev On-Demand instances.

questions.questionText: Your company has recently migrated large amounts of data to the AWS Cloud in S3 buckets. It is necessary to discover and protect the sensitive data in these buckets. Which AWS service can do that?

choices.explanation:
GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system that uncovers unauthorized behavior.
https://aws.amazon.com/guardduty/

Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data.
https://aws.amazon.com/macie/

Inspector works with EC2 instances to uncover and report vulnerabilities.
https://aws.amazon.com/inspector/

CloudTrail tracks user activity and API calls within your account.
https://aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Macie helps you discover and protect sensitive data.
https://aws.amazon.com/macie/

questions.questionText: VPC, CloudFront, and Route 53 are examples of what type of AWS service?

choices.explanation: They are Networking and Content Delivery services.
They are Networking and Content Delivery services.

Amazon VPC, Amazon CloudFront, and Amazon Route 53 are networking and content delivery services that AWS offers. VPC and Route 53 are involved with linking resources with one another to operate interactively; VPC creates a virtual network, and Route 53 connects end users to web applications. CloudFront is an AWS service for fast web content delivery.
[Networking and Content Delivery](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/networking-services.html)
They are Networking and Content Delivery services.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon VPC, Amazon CloudFront, and Amazon Route 53 are networking and content delivery services that AWS offers. VPC and Route 53 are involved with linking resources with one another to operate interactively; VPC creates a virtual network, and Route 53 connects end users to web applications. CloudFront is an AWS service for fast web content delivery.
[Networking and Content Delivery](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/networking-services.html)

questions.questionText: Which service allows you to connect a private cloud to a public cloud?

choices.explanation: SMS allows you to migrate on-premises servers to AWS.
CodeDeploy manages the deployment of code to compute services in the cloud or on-premises.
Route 53 is a DNS service that routes users to applications.
Direct Connect is a dedicated physical network connection from your on-premises data center to AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation: Direct Connect is a dedicated physical network connection from your on-premises data center to AWS.

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services is an example of Platform as a Service?

choices.explanation: This is Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).
This is Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).

Platform as a Service, or PaaS, enables the development, running, and management of applications on the cloud without the need to build and maintain an infrastructure. That is precisely what Elastic Beanstalk provides; it’s the ability to quickly deploy and manage applications in the AWS Cloud without worrying about the infrastructure that runs those applications.
Reference: [AWS Elastic Beanstalk](https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/)
This is Function as a Service (FaaS).

correctAnswers.explanation:
Platform as a Service, or PaaS, enables the development, running, and management of applications on the cloud without the need to build and maintain an infrastructure. That is precisely what Elastic Beanstalk provides; it’s the ability to quickly deploy and manage applications in the AWS Cloud without worrying about the infrastructure that runs those applications.
Reference: [AWS Elastic Beanstalk](https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/)

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: This is Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a database service in AWS?

choices.explanation: Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution.
Neptune is a fully managed graph database that supports highly connected datasets.

Amazon EBS is a storage service providing virtual hard disks in the cloud, while the other services listed are database services.
https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/
Aurora is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL that was created by AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon EBS is a storage service providing virtual hard disks in the cloud, while the other services listed are database services.
https://aws.amazon.com/products/databases/

questions.questionText: In order to comply with regulatory mandates, some of your data needs to be retained in perpetuity. Which of the following AWS storage classes offers low-cost, long-term data archival?

choices.explanation: S3 is an object storage service for the cloud that is highly available.

Glacier is your best choice for deeply discounted, long-term object archival — as long as the data does not need to be available and online at a moment's notice.
https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/
EFS is a serverless network file system for sharing files.
Redshift is a scalable data warehouse solution.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Glacier is your best choice for deeply discounted, long-term object archival — as long as the data does not need to be available and online at a moment's notice.
https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/

questions.questionText: A system's ability to grow to accommodate an increase in demands is an example of which cloud concept?

choices.explanation: Scalability is the concept that describes a measurement of a system's ability to grow to accommodate an increase in demand. Successful, growing, systems often see an increase in demand over time. A system that is scalable can adapt to meet this new level of demand. AWS Documentation: [Scalability](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.scalability.en.html).
High availability is architected by removing single points of failure using system redundancy, enabling systems to almost always maintain uptime.

With elasticity, you have the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you want to do this automatically. AWS Documentation: [Elasticity](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html).
Using AWS services, you can automate manual tasks. Automation relates to simplifying common repeated tasks and removing the human element.

correctAnswers.explanation: Scalability is the concept that describes a measurement of a system's ability to grow to accommodate an increase in demand. Successful, growing, systems often see an increase in demand over time. A system that is scalable can adapt to meet this new level of demand. AWS Documentation: [Scalability](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.scalability.en.html).

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: With elasticity, you have the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. In the cloud, you want to do this automatically. AWS Documentation: [Elasticity](https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/2020-07-02T19-33-23/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html).

questions.questionText: Which of the following does AWS use to notify you by email when you exceed 85% of your Free Tier limits for each service?

choices.explanation: Organizations centralizes the management of your resources; it has nothing to do with usage alerts.
Cost Explorer is actually a visualizer you can use to analyze your spend, but it does not alert you on your Free Tier usage.
AWS Budgets notifies you when you exceed 85% of your Free Tier limits for each service you’re using by sending you an email.
Personal Health Dashboard allows you to visualize the status of your resources, not your usage of them.

correctAnswers.explanation: AWS Budgets notifies you when you exceed 85% of your Free Tier limits for each service you’re using by sending you an email.

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services enables you to continuously monitor and record configuration changes of your resources?

choices.explanation: It can be easy to confuse Config and CloudTrail, since both are AWS management-and-governance tools. However, they operate differently. While CloudTrail provides event history of your AWS account activity, Config lists the configuration change history of the resources in your AWS account.

Config specifically focuses on listing the resources in your AWS account and presenting their configuration change history.
[AWS Config](https://aws.amazon.com/config/)
GuardDuty is an intelligent threat detection system that uncovers unauthorized behavior.
Trusted Advisor provides real-time guidance to help you provision your resources following AWS best practices.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Config specifically focuses on listing the resources in your AWS account and presenting their configuration change history.
[AWS Config](https://aws.amazon.com/config/)

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true of Amazon Aurora?

choices.text: It is a Relational Database Service (RDS) database engine developed by Amazon.
choices.explanation:
Aurora is an RDS engine developed by Amazon.
Reference: [What Is Amazon Aurora?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/CHAP_AuroraOverview.html)

choices.text: It can deliver up to five times the throughput of MySQL.
choices.explanation:
Aurora is 5x faster than normal MySQL and 3x faster than normal PostgreSQL.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements are true of Amazon Redshift?

choices.text: It is used for transactional systems.
choices.explanation: Redshift is not recommended for transactional systems.

choices.text: It is designed for storing petabytes of data.
choices.explanation:
Amazon Redshift is designed to scale up to petabytes of structured data.

Reference: [What Is Amazon Redshift?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/welcome.html)

choices.text: It is a data warehouse service.
choices.explanation:
Amazon Redshift is AWS’s data warehouse service.

Reference: [What Is Amazon Redshift?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/welcome.html)
Redshift does not store unstructured data.

questions.questionText: An organization is considering migrating internal applications to the AWS Cloud. The organization will follow the pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. Which items are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

choices.explanation: Ease of use is not a pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. Ease of use refers to the usability and overall user interface design for a system.

The Operational Excellence pillar includes the ability to support development and run workloads effectively, gain insight into their operations, and to continuously improve supporting processes and procedures to deliver business value. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Operational Excellence](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/operational-excellence.html).

Scalability is not a pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. Scalability (i.e., scaling horizontally for resilience) refers to the ability of a system to adapt to meet the new level of demand and falls under the Reliability pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.

The Reliability pillar encompasses the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when it’s expected to. This includes the ability to operate and test the workload through its total lifecycle. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Reliability](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/reliability.html).

Elasticity is not a pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.

correctAnswers.explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar includes the ability to support development and run workloads effectively, gain insight into their operations, and to continuously improve supporting processes and procedures to deliver business value. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Operational Excellence](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/operational-excellence.html).

The Reliability pillar encompasses the ability of a workload to perform its intended function correctly and consistently when it’s expected to. This includes the ability to operate and test the workload through its total lifecycle. AWS Documentation: [AWS Well-Architected Framework > Reliability](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wellarchitected/latest/framework/reliability.html).

questions.questionText: In AWS, you can stop or terminate instances when not in use. Which of the following concepts describes this capability?

choices.explanation: Scalability is the concept that as cloud has essentially limitless capacity, it allows you to expand out as needed (as detailed in the question).
Coupling defines the interdependencies or connections between components of a system. Loose coupling helps reduce the risk of cascading failures between components.
Using AWS services, you can automate manual tasks. Automation relates to simplifying common repeated tasks and removing the human element.

Elasticity denotes the ability to increase or reduce the number or capabilities of AWS resources when needed. In this case, stopping or terminating instances means you are reducing the number of AWS resources used in your environment.

correctAnswers.explanation: Elasticity denotes the ability to increase or reduce the number or capabilities of AWS resources when needed. In this case, stopping or terminating instances means you are reducing the number of AWS resources used in your environment.

questions.questionText: Who are the main users of the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI)?

choices.explanation: Developers are the main the users of the CLI.
Those in a non-technical role may find the CLI hard to use.
Those in a non-technical role may find the CLI hard to use.
Those new to the cloud may find the CLI hard to use.

correctAnswers.explanation: Developers are the main the users of the CLI.

questions.questionText: When would you use the Reserved Instance pricing model?

choices.text: Your application has steady state usage
choices.explanation: Reserved Instances are a great way of reducing costs on long running applications with steady state usage. Even if the money is not available to make upfront payments, using Reserved Instances over longer periods can still be useful for cost savings. [Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/).

choices.text: Ability to bid on the lowest compute price possible
choices.explanation: This is not the best use case for Reserved Instance pricing.
This is not the best use case for Reserved Instance pricing.

choices.text: Your application requires a capacity reservation
choices.explanation: Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances (RI) can provide a capacity reservation, offering additional confidence in your ability to launch the number of instances you have reserved when you need them. [Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/).

correctAnswers.text: Your application has steady state usage
correctAnswers.explanation: Reserved Instances are a great way of reducing costs on long running applications with steady state usage. Even if the money is not available to make upfront payments, using Reserved Instances over longer periods can still be useful for cost savings. [Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/).

correctAnswers.text: Your application requires a capacity reservation
correctAnswers.explanation: Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances (RI) can provide a capacity reservation, offering additional confidence in your ability to launch the number of instances you have reserved when you need them. [Amazon EC2 Reserved Instances](https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/pricing/reserved-instances/).

questions.questionText: An application that experiences highly variable traffic throughout the day has been configured in AWS. The capacity configured to serve this application adjusts to demands throughout the day. Which AWS principle does this describe?

choices.explanation: This is not a valid feature of AWS.
Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time. These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.
Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.

With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
https://wa.aws.amazon.com/wat.concept.elasticity.en.html

questions.questionText: Which of the following AWS services fall under the Migration and Transfer category?

choices.explanation: Redshift is Amazon’s data warehouse solution.
Snowball is for using devices to transfer large amounts of data in and out of the AWS Cloud.
ElastiCache is an in-memory data store; both are database services.
Database Migration Service is for migrating databases to AWS.

correctAnswers.explanation: Snowball is for using devices to transfer large amounts of data in and out of the AWS Cloud.
Database Migration Service is for migrating databases to AWS.
